Def.Name: Prairie Crabapple
Def.Description: Small tree or shrub, 9' - 35' in height; rounded open crown with spreading branches; can grow a trunk up to 13" in diameter.
Def.Leaves: Simple, alternate, 2 1/2" - 4" long, 1" - 1 1/2" wide, doubly toothed margins that are very often shallowly lobed with dark green and often hairy below; yellow in autumn; can have a stalk that is hairy.
Def.Twigs: Red-brown, often hairy, thorlike spur shoots usually present on branchlets, thorn are rough with leaves or buds attached; buds, red-brown, hairy.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Pome, 1" - 1 1/2" in diameter, yellowish-green, clustered on short spur shoots, leathery core, mature in late summer.
Def.Remarks: Bitter fruits are an important food for birds, squirrels and rabbits. Slow to grow. Can grow dense around streams, forest edges and prairies.
